meanings.definition: A particular form or variant of something.
meanings.sent1: There are many versions of the story told by different people.
meanings.sent2: I prefer the digital versions of books over physical copies.
meanings.sent3: The different versions of the cake recipe all turned out delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had many versions, each revealing a different emotion.
meanings.sent5: The artist created multiple versions of the painting before choosing the final one.

meanings.definition: A translation of a text in another language.
meanings.sent1: The book has been translated into various versions for international readers.
meanings.sent2: I always compare different versions of the poem to understand its true meaning.
meanings.sent3: The comedic version of the play had the audience laughing non-stop.
meanings.sent4: His interpretation of the poem was like a unique version of a classic song.
meanings.sent5: The software provides accurate versions of the text in multiple languages.

meanings.definition: A particular edition or release of a piece of software or technology.
meanings.sent1: The latest version of the app includes new features for users.
meanings.sent2: I always update my phone to the newest versions of software.
meanings.sent3: The beta version of the game had some amusing glitches.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knows no bounds when it comes to designing new versions of apps.
meanings.sent5: The company announced the release of the next version of their popular software.
